Zach_Top:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter (born 1997)}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Zach Top | image = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1997|9|26}} | birth_place = [[Sunnyside, Washington]], U.S. | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Neotraditional country]]{{Cite web |title=Zach Top |url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/zach-top-mn0004223792 |access-date=July 17, 2024 |website=[[AllMusic]]}} * [[Bluegrass music|bluegrass]] }} | occupation = Singer-songwriter | instrument = {{flatlist| * Vocals * guitar }} | years_active = 2019–present | label = Leo33 | website = {{URL|https://zachtop.com/}} }} '''Zachary Dirk Top''' (born September 26, 1997) is an American [[country music]] singer-songwriter from [[Sunnyside, Washington]] signed to Leo33. ==Background== Zach Top was born on September 26, 1997,{{Cite web |title=Zach Top |url=https://www.opry.com/artists/zach-top |access-date=July 17, 2024 |website=[[Grand Ole Opry]]}} and grew up on a ranch in [[Sunnyside, Washington]]. He got his musical start performing as part of a [[Bluegrass music|bluegrass]] band with his siblings called Top String.{{cite web|url=https://zachtop.com/bio|title=Bio — Zach Top Official|website=Zach Top|access-date=June 7, 2024}} After performing as part of various bluegrass groups throughout his teens and early twenties, Top relocated to [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] in 2021, where he first signed a publishing deal with Major Bob Music. He began recording as a solo artist in 2019, releasing a string of bluegrass singles that culminated in the release of his self-titled debut [[Extended play|EP]] with RBR Entertainment on May 13, 2022.{{cite web|url=https://rbrentertainment.com/zack-top|title=RBR Entertainment — Zach Top|website=RBR Entertainment|access-date=June 7, 2024}} He pivoted to recording [[country music]] and in September 2023, it was announced that Top was signed as the flagship artist for the newly-formed independent record label Leo33.{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2023/09/leo33-signs-flagship-artist-zach-top/|title=Leo33 Signs Flagship Artist Zach Top|author=LB Cantrell|date=September 6, 2023|website=Music Row|access-date=June 7, 2024}} His debut single to country radio, "[[Sounds Like the Radio]]", was released on January 8, 2024, and was the most-added song at the format with 55 stations adding the song upon impact.{{cite web|url=https://issuu.com/countryaircheck/docs/issue_891_-_janaury_8_2024|title=Country Aircheck Weekly January 7, 2024, Issue 891|date=January 8, 2024|website=Country Aircheck|access-date=June 7, 2024}} It has since charted in the top 30 of the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Country Airplay]] chart. Top co-wrote "Sounds Like the Radio" with [[Carson Chamberlain]] and Wyatt McCubbin, inspired by his love of 1990s-era country music and artists such as [[George Strait]], [[Keith Whitley]], and [[Randy Travis]].{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/country/zach-top-sounds-like-the-radio-makin-tracks-1235611345/|title=Zach Top on Revisiting the '90s – 'The Peak of Country Music' — With Throwback 'Sounds Like The Radio'|author=Tom Roland|date=February 21, 2024|magazine=Billboard|access-date=June 7, 2024}} It served as the lead single to Top's debut studio album, ''[[Cold Beer & Country Music]]'', which was released on April 5, 2024.{{cite web|url=https://holler.country/reviews/zach-top-cold-beer-and-country-music/|title=Zach Top – Cold Beer & Country Music Review and Tracklist|author=Soda Canter|date=April 4, 2024|website=Holler|access-date=June 7, 2024}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of studio albums, with selected details, chart positions and sales ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:14em;" | Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:18em;" | Album details ! scope="col" colspan="3" | Peak chart positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! scope="col" style="width:4em;" | [[Billboard 200|US]]
